text: Great value for what you get
From Elaine at the 38th lounge that took care of us and the magnificent Housekeeping staff that kept our room so elegant always
Amenities was not attractive at all
Overall a very sad and pathetic experience
The staff were exceptionally friendly and attentive and really looked out for us
Check-in was slow but we appreciated the calmness of the Club room check-in compared to the general check-in on the ground floor
There was a long message in three different languages about how much they valued our patronage and that the conversation would be recorded, blah blah
Breakfast is quite far away from our room, like 10 minus walk, and we've waited like 10 minus outside the restaurant assigned
The buffet breakfast with flies in the seating area outside while the inside AC was freezing cold
The check-in lines were too long
Room condition was poor
This is a massive hotel with super long check in lines
I asked if there was any upgrade during in person check in, the check in person immediately told me no without even looking the computer
people were piling up the food they cannot finish and it was like a disaster relief centre
After arriving at the Macau Ferry Terminal, we were greeted by the bell boy was very kind
The amenity in the bathroom was cheap
I haven't been in a regular room in years
Housekeeping did a good job too
It was a terrible experience and i doubted this is a 5-star hotel quality
Perfect hardware, comfortable bed, big screen TV with lots of channels.
The view was ok
when I checked in, the unprofessional staff at front desk me that I need to check out the deluxe room on and then check-in again for the club room
tip: to avoid the looong walk hoose sky tower if available
room was non-smoking but often a strong smoke smell would come into our room
Breakfast service not good club room too big and not enough staff to run it
Other employees were very kind, too
The service is first rate, and no lines for checkin and checkout like many hotels
Wifi was slow and disonncected regularly and I found it frustrating
Sheraton is a brand that I am familiar with
The hotel fixed the check-in time at 3pm but they are not consider flexible check-in time to avoid crowded in the lobby at the same time
But really sunk it for me though was the service level in the bars and restaurants
After lined up over 20 minutes to check-in, the receptionists told us they couldn't find our bookings with 2 rooms
Unfortunately, our most recent stay was spoiled by a petty dispute on checkout, that was unwarranted, dragged on for almost half an hour and just unpleasant
The dressing gowns are the same
When I walked into the hallway I found a bit musty, I thought it was the air con was not strong enough, but it turns out they are a bit old
The first time I stayed here is few months ago, which I just keep moving around, don't really have time to look up the hotel at all, but I got a good first impression back then
Breakfast: Due to the high occupancy, guests were being arranged to have their breakfast at FEAST / XIN according to their room location
So I went to the SPG counter, the queue is long and there's only two staff at the counter, and they took ages to finish one check-in, one even keep chatting with the customers on and off
The room was clean and very comfortable
the waiter then looked away from us, to make it obvious that he didn't want to be bothered with questions
The rooms were plenty large, with two doubles and a very comfortable rollaway
Rooms have a spectacular view of the Macau peninsula, but more importantly, is the management and the team that are always available to meet your needs/demands, and always with a smile
Tried the pool side bar for lunch but seemed a little overprice for the selection they had
However, afternoon tea is really disappointed
The broadway street had many food stalls
Moment into the hotel if they have entered another world, checkin, a lobby guidelines, the floor waiter amiable face so unforgettable
The taxi queue is so long mainly due to poor design
) and I've told the staff about the problem numerous times
No coffee / tea was served, in fact only 2 staff helping at 08:00AM
Needless to say, we couldn't use wi-fi during our stay at the hotel
The view of the room is good
A busy place with lots of people roaming around to enjoy the facilities
The valet parking staffs were so arrogant and not willing to provide assistance, they even asked me to park in the public car park by myself
not miss it's cuisine Resturant special golden peacock hotel but the only thing which pisses you off is check inn process which really slow
The decor is rather simple
On arrival you are greeted by a very lengthy roped off pen and staff to tell you 'check in is closed and you must return at 1
Best of all, the service-minded of staff is excellence where they are always able to help us
But the casino is disappointing
Which only means the room is now at HK$4,000/night (yeah right...)
Overall, I was very disappointed with the food and was glad I was able to find some inexpensive local restaurants in the historic centre and in Taipa village
The room cleaners are the unsung heroes who usually come in and do their job when we are not around, so it was nice to have the chance to meet Jay
I asked them for their manager and the staff bluntly replies that the manager sits behind in the back office without lifting his head
We had trouble with the lift system -  only some lifts will take you to your floor and this is not clearly marked
It is a huge building divided by a few hotels and casino area in the middle
Location close to airport and they provide free shuttle bus
But the biggest disappointment was in the checkout
The key card cover only handwritten "2-1334"

So many things that make a hotel stay great did not exist here, First of all, we are SPG members, so we SHOULD be able to check in at the SPG counter, but they would not let us check in as we didn't have the card on us at the moment
Our Club Room was on the 31st Floor, for a 5* hotel this was dissapointing and the room  can only be described as basic and underwhelming, certainly not to the standard I was expecting
Also my wifi amenity didn't work and after 20 minutes trying to rectify it I gave up
Lifts are very overcrowded and offers a monday morning experience in a crowded office lift lobby
The location of the hotel is not exactly at the tourist attractions its a few minutes drive which was perfect because it was calm and quiet away from the other busy hotels and noisy casinos

Cons: - Feast (Lunch Buffet) - food was very bland, though there are numerous choices -Lack of things to do in the area -Location, a bit far from the City (though taxi's are cheap) -No food options in the area  This Sheraton_
and I got a room in the Grand Club
Looked for somewhere to eat on my own and gave up - myriad of faceless buffets

As a Starwood Guest I was first offered an alternative room with a better view, but on learning that my wife and I were staying for a couple of nights to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary we were upgraded fully to a suite that provided us with luxury we could only dream of
the senior staff is no smile and seems impolite
counters on Main Lobby was chaotic
Despite the very bad smell they were not able to tell us with what kind of chemicals we have been sprayed, we've just been informed that it's 'fertilizer'
I read favourable reviews of this hotel at tripadvisor and decided to make a booking for 2 Bella Suite several days ago
Unfortunately, staff cannot meet the basic service standard and it's totally disappointing everyone of us
The room conditions we stayed in were also excellent
The facilities and room service are excellent The pool in the room is terrific for kids And, Mr Jerico from housekeeping is extremely caring and helpful
The pool is overcrowded, and a child was actually seen peeing in the pool from the side! All in all, very shoddy service indeed
During the 3 days staying, Cleaning service was poor that always not give the water then we requested the cleaning service
Rooms are dated
Good toiletries
Spacious rooms equipped with everything you might need
Spent 2 very comfortable nights in this luxurious hotel/resort
Being a part of Starwood group, guest experience and product offerings are as expected
The worst was the bell service
I still remembered we queue for check-in process which kept us waiting for more than half an hour
Several things that bothered me:  1) Hotel is huge but the sign is not clear
Quality of service was scattered all over the place, with the clear lack of sense of efficiency and direction
One of the email mentioned they have a checkin counter - JW Marriott Bonvoy Counter to enhance an better arrival experience
4) there were no water left in the ladies locker room, the cleaning staff said "there's water outside" that means we don't need to drink there, there's water outside of the locker room
The hotel is great with reasonable price
Came back to order room service but no menu in the room
Wonderful rooms, with beautiful views and every amenity; pool also one of a kind
We were escorted to the concierge located at the top floor once we arrived and our luggages were all carried by the helpful staff
When I came through the front entrance, I was mind-blowen by how nice it looked as first looks
This is a very good luxury hotel with perfect service
Excellent food and drink service in evening in the lounge
starting with the friendly welcome by the conceirge who escorts you in the lift to reception
Further that I have SPG Platinum but check-in staff told me I am Gold (Yes, I was Gold in 3 years ago)
To start with: while the rooms are nice, the location is just wrong
(on a weekday and in July? this place must be havoc) Food was good, plenty of chinese and western dishes including Indian selections too
But to really make the most of it, at least stay for 3 nights and then you'd enjoy the gambling, shops and the food
The Housekeeping is', '_'
We booked a Junior Suite which I believed this type of room shouldn\'t be that popular
The checkin service counter staff were so rude, they actually told us to 'go away', come back later, Also, the rooms were not cleaned, nor new supplies replenished
Check in and out is not prioritised for AccorPlus member
The check-in process is very quick, and the room is spacious
The room whilst large was dated and shower malfunction
And the service and buffet at the club lounge are quite good
There was a bunk bed, small table with 2 bean chairs
This is (without a doubt) one of the best hotels in Macau
The service was not great
Room is spacious but neither well-maintained nor any special
Check in at the club lounge was slow
Amenities were not in the room and had to make a request three times for them
It's so big that noone is allowed to check in before 3pm
But lobby is very noisy & lift are very crowded especially during night time
This hotel is the worst hotel with service compared in the other sheaton hotel in different country i have been lived
From the first day we arrived at our room, even though we clearly check in as 4 adults, all the amenities, towel, slipper, bottle water etc only prepared for 2 person
Ended up I walked around for quite a while until a western gentleman helped me and my family out for the right way to go
i again call to the reception that wifi is not working
I was there for a summit meeting and loved the facilities and very very friendly staffs
The front desk lady took me personally to my suite, which was very nice
Too too many people that took us long time to check in even at the spg reception
Their attitude is completely unacceptable

The manner in which the staff spoke to you made it seem like you were passing through a security check-point (gave off a vibe that made you feel as if you were someone trying to sneak through the security into a hotel that you could not afford)
Pool ran out of towels no drinks etc
One minor bad point, which is the temperature of the water
Our room was SPECTACULAR  We had 2 adults and 2 children
I had an allergy due to dust mites on the bed sheets
The hotel is well maintained, check in was a breeze and the rooms were huge
It is very disappointing given how many rooms there are here, and that they have a designated check in for elite members
queued for at least 30mins to check in even as a SPG member
I have stayed in this Sheraton several times before but this experience was the most disappointing
The only bad note is that we were told we would have a sofa bed in the suite but when we arrived it turned out to be a normal sofa
Warning on check in and out, takes a min of 20-30mins which is pretty painful when with_
The pools were refreshing, although the construction surrounding it surely soured the mood
Also the service from the breakfast in Xin restaurant was way below average
Unfortunatly, when i collected my two mooncake boxes, i was so disappointed by the outlook and mooncake quality
Watch out for the charges they levy if you pay by Amex
never again  Room service was almost non-existent
The hotel is huge and getting from one place to another can be quite a walk
Check-in was a poor experience
We checked in the hotel on the New Year's Eve with booking of 2 rooms for my brother's family and myself with my parents
Windows restaurant is a great meeting place in the lobby for food drinks with outside dining, Four Seasons is just above and beyond
Several good staff around but overall worst ever experience
I never had met the worst treatment by the Conrad Macau Hotel receptionist " Shaylee" before
The young one dashed to the long sofa and start pressing the tv
For example, the water control in the shower only have one direction
As we expected front desk employee would not even care about the guests
However, the Family Suite we booked came with a bunk bed, the top bunk of which did not have a mattress - it had a stone-hard mattress base that was covered by a mattress topper
The interesting part was the housekeeping tidy the entire room except the bathroom
The staff was amazing:  from the porters to the management, the service was consistently great without being overbearing, even for us average Joe's
Front desk staff needs to be more familiar with the own promotion package

The numerous facilities are world class from Gym to Business Centre, while the bedrooms provide a very high standard of comfort with a very modern take from the cool bathroom design to high tech TV systems
so i had to come back at 2 and waited in the line for another 45 mins before we could get our key
It was 11.45 pm when we called room service (it was indeed late by normal standards, however, in Macau, the service was still at full scale, even in late night)
the shuttles to and from the airport/ HK-Macau ferry is a terrific bonus
The view was stunning as we were upgraded to a suite facing the resort
Despite management's claim that they are trying to improve their check-in process, the line to check-in is still indeed one hour
When we were taken to our first room,  we just started to settle in, and got a call that the adjacent room was actually not available, a mistake
Huge variety of food at the Breakfast buffet at Spotlight.
Reply my enquiry quickly and offer a spa package which includes upgrade to suite,  one way transfer and club lounge benefits etc.
I was so disappointed cause it is the 5 stars international hotels group but some of their staff are dishonesty
The staffs are very professional and kind

The Bad:  Way too many guests - check-in takes a long time and it's crowded everywhere   Tip #1:  check out the SPG check-in counter as the queue is shorter and the staff are actually quite understanding during the peak / crowded hours
I look forward to staying again
Second, the kid bedroom was disappointing, no toys, a xbox with no game and no gamepad, the only tv channel was cartoon network and there was no sound only for this channel
Our special request for rooms nearer to the lift lobby were well noted and our old folks  really appreciated the shorter walk
Good location
Room was clean but 1 key card needed replacment took me standing in front of room door for  n3arly 15m  Yes, the hotel was too complicated to get lost
To keep a long story short, we had booked 2 rooms, as we were traveling as a family with the grandparents along to help watch the kids
So that I tried to process my checkin there, however, the first thing I suffer is the staff at the entrance shout to me are you our member In an impolite way surely
The tower rail on the shower door practically fell off making it very inconvenient for us
I still remembered we queue for check-in process which kept us waiting for more than half an hour
Firstly, due to the uneven air-conditioning in room, I wanna to request for an extra blanket
You have to do it when you book
I particularly liked the bathroom: huge and beautifully decorated
And the pool is really quite mediocre compared to the competition
Once again, Sheraton outdid the competition in service and amenities for us and our two kids, 10 and 12
Besides the usual expected of Sheraton n a very helpful housekeeping staff on duty on 11 & 13 Dec, service of staff whom I encountered was a disappointment
The unfriendly staff give you the worst rooms
We went outside until 3 pm and come back , and still, the room is not ciean yet!!!
The next morning we awoke to a tiny dead cockroach on our sheets
And the hotel knows what ferry I am coming in on and is waiting for my check-in
When I used the shower room, all the water was leaking out from the shower room to the bathroom and I was shocked to see everything was flooding when I came out
security personnel are like waiting for a tip, and if you don't give a tip, they will snob and make face plus laugh behind your back
Restaurant I did not try Looked good
What really put me off were perhaps expectations I have become accustomed to in the West - hence I wanted to caveat this before my review
The room smells so bad
This hotel has nice facilities but the service is poor and significantly lower than my expectations
Overall experience was that of a mass scale hotel with 0 five star services - except for an occasional smiling staff
Ask for non smoking room smelled of smoke
Dont forget to make use of the free shuttle service to and from the airport and also to many places in the city
The biggest problem was that we were served by an untrained crew during check in, so it took us more than 15 mins to finish the procedure, and I didnt quite feel that they felt sorry for that
Breakfast variety in club lounge is quite a lot but we saw some flies hovering over the donuts and avoided that dish
As you know Macau in a Las Vegas on steroids and this place in no exception to that    Big difference is the Small Service (notice the Capitalization) they offer
There was no greetings when I went to Bene for breakfast, was left there not knowing whether I shall go in and find a seat directly all by myself or someone will usher me in
however at the end of the day, I'm disappointed that we didn't experience what we expected to in booking the club lounge
Their staff is dealing with guests like robots - one comes and one goes- nothing more
The only thing disappointed us was the meal we had in the Peking Restaurant on the lobby floor
There is no drinks in fridge, and the minibar is at economic hotel level
The lounge area is one of the best of my experience
The cleaners also never cleaned the cups and gave us so little toiletries
I can't fall asleep because of that noise and I have to_
The casino floors to the facade to the rooms are super for the entire family
Glad to receive some pre-welcome email from the hotel before my stay
real disappointing  Room wise things are looking wired and towels definitely need a change
Secondly, there was no electrical outlet in the bathroom
Check in and check out is a drab, dreary, slow affair and we missed our bus to the ferry in spite of having almost 30 minutes to spare
I had to change the room but even changed room condition was not so different

But once you got the room, it started giving you amazing experience, it was glamorous, the room was spacious, beautiful view of the city, it was a pity that the external side of the glass window so dusty

In-room dining staff didn't understand my English and I could barely understand his (never ceases to amaze me that an American brand hotel doesn't employ and place English speaking people in key position_
Free shuttle bus available to Galaxy area
Definitely get a breakfast in room-delicious food, Amazing The service is very attentive and you will feel like a celebrity the way they treat you
The check in was not organized at all and took over 10 minutes leaving the waiting time aside
Check-out: It was busy and the staff (forgot', '_'
The slowest check in I have ever experienced
The moment you enter the main lobby, you are lost in the sea of people and the chatter and clatter reminds you of some over crowded flea market
professional Mark and Jay from belldesk, helped us with our luggage during check in and check out, and even helped us to grab a taxi upon our departure
On the final day I was well enough to go to the outside pool
Especially to Jane Genivieve, Gladys Catangal, and to the Restaurant Manager, She Magallanes Gonzales that accommodates us
The shower area will flood while taking shower
Upon arrival I was warmly welcomed by the staff with very kind
Room: Hotel elevators do not have secured access to guest room floors, which is surprising as this is a relatively new hotel
The Sofitel is perfectly located just walking distance away from the Largo do Senado (and of course the Church of St Dominic and ruins of St Paul's Cathedral)
As a long time Accor Advantage members we are very disappointed for the service provided
When I got to the room on the 21/F, it was a nasty view of the rooftop and a bunch of pools that no one uses
so make sure u eat at Bambu restaurant
We arrived at the front desk and was greeted by a gentleman called Curtis

when we passed by the lobby, the queue for checking in is unbelievably long
We have spent lots of time selecting our accommodation at Macau in pervious , We chose MGM Cotai hotel in finally because We have searched the reviews mostly is great.
The chair was so dirty that I got a very bad impression about the cleanliness of this hotel

The steps to the bed has very sharp corners so a toddler needs to be watched all the time to be safe

The breakfast system was also not efficient
I'm not sure when the Earth Tower was built, but the room furnishings looked looked worn and tired and the decor was a bit of a letdown considering how the property has been advertised
Although I switch on the air conditioner, the smell still strong
the lady staff used her  body to block me to go in, I felt so insulted
The room was very luxurious with a pool inside the room
In short, the room rate was bit expensive without breakfasts and Wi-fi
That is not a good service which Sheraton should be  2 / there have a lot of lanes
The hotel service is excellent
I ordered breakfast from room service, which was also tasty and for a decent price
Poor staff product knowledge
The price of breakfast was expensive but the hotel provided big discount if you buy coupon during check in
The pool was great but one thing I noticed, not enough staff around
Overall I would say it's quite standard - rooms, amenities, etc
It is an amazing infinity pool in the middle of the building where you have a view of the city
We did not have any problems at all during check-in and it only took 20 minutes to get our keycard after arrival to the hotel
Lockly I have a platinum membership so we had to wait for only 15 min
As usual the room is clean and comfortable.
weird Working table is stainlesssteel one like using at office
If this is the level of service and facilities I can expect from every Sheraton hotel then I shall definitely look to using their hotels in the future
The best part of our experience was when we went to the resort deck and in the Cabana
Outisde it's much nicer then inside

Unfortunately we arrived after 9pm and there was no more food service, not even drinks, we got bottled water, better than nothing
When we showed up at the hotel at 5:30PM the rooms were not ready yet and was told we would need to wait
We were upgraded to the executive (17th) floor with a wonderful harbour view

Upon checking in we were told that our room was not ready yet, and were shown to the lounge, where we were provided 1 drink each - there was no food, and by this stage the kids were hungry and miserable
One of the worst pool experiences at an otherwise not bad hotel
Furniture scratched and dented
My first visit to this hotel was on mid April, our family booked two rooms through Sherwood website
One other thing that would be great to improve is the variety of food
Don't miss the swimming pool, again it gives you the most amazing view
The staff were so helpful, we barely had to touch our bags as they were transported to and from our room and even through to the next hotel we stayed in
After an exceptional stay at the Sheraton Nanshan, this property fell short in welcoming me as a Lifetime Titanium Elite guest
First of all, the shower was only equipped with a shower curtain, no glass door, it was only spacious but with a cheap shower curtain
Oh, and the second room in the suite smelled of sewage
The hotel is nothing less than a royal experience
The bed is so big and comfortable
But food is good and if you like european breakfast it's good selection of food
Great staff
the room itself was large, but nothing that special and certainly not super luxe, the fittings etc look cheap and not high quality
Check in is a disaster with long queues (and I am a premium Starwood member) - and if you succeed to find anybody working here - then you have won at the casino
It is a shame though that even all of the non smoking rooms reek for cigarettes
The room is a great surprise facing Macau side and observing with detail the huge structure been build to accommodate the bridge Hong Kong -Zhuhai- Macau
Fast and excellent service of food
However, the experience of checkout and breakfast is worst, where during the checkout only 2 staff on duty (along with 20 empty counter
The room (a suite) was exceedingly spacious, especially for a brief stay
The signs are not really visible in which elevators to take which adds to the confusions
Wi-fi was poor throughout the hotel, even in the room
Otherwise the shower ground was very slippery
We did not enjoy the club lounge, it is dark and quite far away from the club floor rooms
And what made it extra memorable was the level of care given by the Guest Services Supervisor Rev, he truly went above and beyond and took such good care of us during the whole stay
Woke up after 3h of sleep due to huge noise of hotel personell in the corridor, caused by laughing, loud talking, shouting
But for a 5 star hotel, you couldn't believe that there was no comb in the bathroom for use

The evening food in the lounge was awful and basically 'mall foodcourt' quality at best catering exclusive for Asian guests with virtually no international choice (which you would not expect at a Sheraton)
The overcrowding was bad especially in the lobby and lifts
I was overall happy with our stay except for the cleanliness of the shower
at one part of the lobby, There was also a small booth giving out cups of marshmallow and popcorns for kids
The phone keeps ringing and ringing, not even the promo message or what-so-ever
The Front office Miguel was so polite and very professional, Very kind and the Manager as well
I suspect the management has changed hands to local management
On top of it, we left our at 11am & got back at 4pm & our room was not cleaned
No plates at stations
couldn't even fix a tea

I got to the hotel by the free shuttle they offer from the ferry terminal at 10am and the lady who checked me in was kind enough to give me an upgrade to a suite (for being a diamond member on HHonors) and an early check-in, on a smoking room though
The breakfast was actually really great
There are two towers, I was staying in the earth tower which is very far from the pool
Every time it has been a pleasant place to stay in a good location but every time it has taken an eternity to check in
Although it came with free WIFI, the connection was spotty and slow
This was already around 1.20 am
One small issue was the room was not available when we checked in but the staff more than made up for that through settling us in
The pool facilities were fantastic, but there are not many pool chairs so if they are full you may need to be a little patient
so sad, the staff should arrange it
Biggest pool was closed

For example there wasn't really a bar for drinks and snacks in the hotel - conference food wasn't very good - the decor inside felt the same as the nearby Venetian!  Recommendation - if you are staying in Macau for a holiday, try to find a smaller hotel for a better experience, not one which focuses on just on conferences and gambling
The moment we stepped on the vicinity of hotel the bellboy gave us a smile and a helping hand
We arrived at the lobby and the staff still remembered my name and when I was there the last time
but disappointed by the mob mentality of the place
The taxi lines are also long and unforgiving
The Club lounge is very professional, with good drinks and food and most attentive service of all staff-members
First of all when I do check in the staff seems don't know I booked a package with afternoon tea, he needed to double check see if I was booking a package
Moreover my daughter was disappointed about the lack of some poolf fun such as water slides
Huge living room, huge dining room and entertainment room.
The breakfast buffet at this club lounge was a full spread and not like the other club lounges where you'd tend to get a very limited buffet spread
The hotel really need to train the staff to be polite
The way he communicate with me was very professional.
The checkin took ages and the experience was worse than a one-star Mainland China Hotel
The foyer is full of people, maybe the foyer was not designed large enough to cope that large amount of tourists coming through, having the casino sharing the same entrance with the hotel
All the filipino staves and security personnel from the hotel and in casino are all acting bossy and disrespectful
However, no toys or books in the room and only Cartoon Channel available on TV
To be honest, this is the most unforgettable birthday that I have ever had
It is a very large hotel with lots of rooms
At reception, when staff asked for feedback, I related incident but receptionist did not apologize for bad service at all
Our room was fantastic, great views, twice daily room clean up and such a comfortable bed
This asides, my biggest issue is with their concierge
I realized that this - never before seen - wait in line was not due to capacity issues but rather organisation
The room is filthy as it smells like old room, and the bedding aren't clean
I'd love recommend it to other friends and clients for the implacable sea view in the room and its excellent services
In order to sleep more properly, we had to put some extra effort into getting used to the loud-noise air-conditioning
Apparently the largest hotel in macau with 4,000 rooms  I only got my key at 6pm, not great  "Forest" theme in the lobby and there's an ok shopping mall attached
Checkin was pretty chaotic - huge line and people walking all over the place (especially groups
But as soon as I checked-in, the toilet seat was dirty
When we first come inside the room, few dirty and used pens are on the floor
It took the staff nearly an hour to find us a new room
The club lounge is impersonal beyond belief and the hungry horde that arrives for breakfast simply ruins the ambience of the lounge
For a quick visit, we felt the hospitality of the staff, very good food from the brassiere and most of all the view of the tower
The individual quality of staff there need improvement
Everything is some distance away, including the walk from the check in desk to the lift where your room is
We have our dinner in Bamboo restaurant, which is OK
we stay there one night, during the time we stay there, none of their staff visit us or make any concern
I didnt try the spa or other attractions so can't comment on those
The lobby smells of smoke
Good that there are the Filipinos Receptions/ attendant who help us and give us a very good service
It was the BEST decision I've made in terms of hotel upgrade
The bath towels that were provided to us were old and fray
It really ruined my stay in the hotel
For a HHonors member is good.
The staff show zero care or interest in you, and take no action to stop_
F&B:  Japanese buffet choices/ selections are very good

When we checked in I asked them just to make sure I was on the 75th anniversary package which in included daily breakfast/lunch, ferry tickets back to Hong Kong and sheratons anniversary gift but I was told no I was on a room only tariff
During club lounge visit, the staff never greeted me
The burger they served was burned, literally and they charged for it too
We noticed that the corridors have no air vents or very few - making it a very sweaty and smelly walk to and from the guest rooms
The bathroom itself is also huge and equipped with all the toiletries that I need
The phone wasn't working in the room, good thing that there was 3(at least) phones, 2 were not working, but the last one we found was working fine
We stayed three adults in one room and got a comfortable extra bed in no time after arrival
Requested to change pillow and do house keeping again but have old people smell
The room was plunged in darkness, the air-conditioning disappeared
We had a good Spa experience in a "Couple's Room" (for a MOP500 surcharge) that featured a private sauna and Jacuzzi
Room design and Resort (inner swimming pool and jacuzzi) quite good Staff service quolity especially Concierge and Room service is excellent
I understand such wait Is inevitable for a 4000 room hotel like this, but they could had been more flexible on taking check-in to reduce the waiting line
Rooms are 3* at best and the pool is terrible
